summary: This bill, the "No More Funding for NPR Act of 2025," seeks to prohibit federal funding for National Public Radio (NPR). It would prevent federal funds from being directly or indirectly allocated to NPR and its successors, including through public broadcast stations. The bill includes provisions for rescinding unobligated federal funds for NPR in 2025 and 2026. However, exceptions are made for disseminating urgent public safety information during FEMA-led disaster response. The bill was introduced to the House of Representatives on February 7, 2025.
